data_maturity_score.evidence: Traditional BI stack (Tableau, SQL, Oracle, Hive) with no modern data engineering practices mentioned. No CI/CD, testing, or monitoring signals. Enterprise environment suggests basic automation but limited modern practices.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Score of 2 indicates developing stage - basic BI tools and some automation, but lacks modern data engineering practices and governance

maturity_signals.evidence: No modern data stack, CI/CD, data quality testing, or governance practices mentioned in job posting

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused BI/data engineering role with clear Tableau and analytics focus. No mention of multiple roles or responsibilities beyond BI work.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: No work-life balance signals mentioned, consulting environment may have client deadlines, but IBM is generally stable employer with standard hours

role_clarity.evidence: Well-defined BI data engineer role focused on Tableau dashboards, SQL queries, and analytics. Clear technical requirements and responsibilities.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk - stable IBM role but onsite requirement, no salary transparency, traditional tech stack, and consulting environment may have pressure

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No reporting structure, manager level, or team hierarchy mentioned in job description

team_composition.evidence: No team size, composition, or structure information provided in job posting

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Working in IBM Consulting centers suggests centralized consulting model rather than embedded cross-functional teams

work_life_balance_score.evidence: No work-life balance signals mentioned, consulting environment may have client deadlines, but IBM is generally stable employer. Onsite requirement limits flexibility.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Mentions 'limitless career path' but no specific learning budget, conference attendance, or growth programs mentioned. Traditional BI focus may limit modern data engineering growth.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Traditional BI stack with no modern engineering practices mentioned. IBM is established but this role appears maintenance-focused rather than innovative.

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on maintaining existing Tableau dashboards and content management systems suggests maintenance role rather than innovation

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of modernizing systems, improving code quality, or addressing technical debt

ai_integration_level.evidence: No AI, ML, or advanced analytics mentioned - pure business intelligence and dashboard focus

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML tools mentioned - focus is on traditional BI tools (Tableau, SQL, Oracle, Hive)

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgency indicators mentioned - standard IBM hiring process expected

competition_level.evidence: IBM is competitive employer, but India-based onsite role may have moderate competition. Traditional BI skills are common but IBM brand attracts candidates.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: IBM is clearly a large, established enterprise company with global operations and consulting divisions

hiring_velocity.evidence: IBM Consulting likely has steady hiring for client delivery centers, but no specific expansion mentioned

team_size_signals.evidence: IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers are large-scale operations with hundreds of employees

funding_stage_signals.evidence: IBM is a publicly traded, established multinational corporation

role_creation_type.evidence: Likely expansion of consulting delivery capabilities, though specific reason not mentioned

strength_details: Stable employment with IBM, a global technology leader
Clear BI/data engineering role with defined technical requirements
Master's degree requirement indicates professional development focus
concern_details: No salary, benefits, or compensation information provided
Onsite role in Pune requires relocation with no remote options
Traditional BI stack (Tableau, SQL, Oracle) with no modern data engineering tools
No growth opportunities, learning budget, or career development mentioned
Unclear reporting structure and team composition
best_fit_details: BI analysts transitioning to data engineering with Tableau expertise
Professionals seeking stable enterprise employment at established company
Candidates with Master's degrees looking for traditional BI/data analyst roles
probe_details: Ask about salary range, benefits, and total compensation package
Understand reporting structure and management hierarchy
Clarify team size and composition within the consulting center
Discuss career progression and growth opportunities within IBM
Confirm if any remote work flexibility is possible in the future
leverage_details: Being located in Pune area eliminates relocation costs and enables immediate start
Strong Tableau and BI dashboard experience is valuable for consulting delivery
summary.overall_assessment: Standard BI data engineer role at established IBM consulting division. Stable employment with clear technical requirements but limited growth opportunities and traditional technology stack. Main trade-offs are onsite requirement, lack of modern data engineering practices, and unclear compensation details.
